title: Kenya: Cops Storm Port of Mombasa, Search Vessel for Drugs, Firearms
text:
Nigeria: Porous Airports and Rising Stowaways By Elkana Jacob 
Heavily armed inter-agency detectives forced their way into the Port of Mombasa and searched a vessel for drugs and firearms on Thursday night. 
They made their way in through gate 10, roughed up and handcuffed several KPA security personnel on suspicion that they would cause alarm and leak information. 
This was after a Hoegh transporter vessel, suspected to contain the drugs and firearms, docked at the port to offload cargo and leave. 
Most of the cars in the vessel were imports from Japan and Dubai and there were also several UN cars that were to be transported to Uganda. 
KPA head of security Mohamed Morowa was arrested during the raid by the 25 officers at about 10am, that saw them man the main gates. 
No cars were allowed in or out of the port from which OCPD Zacchaeus Ng'eno, deputy Charity Wangui and KPA managing director Gichiri Ndua were sent out. 
The Star found that neither newly posted county commander Francis Wanjohi nor KPA security personnel knew about the operations. 
"I was informed at the last minute that a joint force was in my region, but they did not shed more light into their mission," he said, adding that the detectives were winding up their search. 
Ndua said they are yet to quantify resulting losses but that operations have resumed. 
Following the arrest of three women enroute to Garissa and then Somalia on Wednesday, there were fears that al Shabaab had taken over the port. 
The Star established that Nargis Gulam, Mwanajuma Tayari and Saumu Athman were detained at Port police station. 
"They were masked and heavily armed with confiscated firearms. In fact I called my husband telling him that al Shabaab had attacked us," gate 10 security officer Sofia Changani had said. Kenya
